name: stream-combiner

scripts.test: set -e; for t in test/*.js; do node $t; done

readme: # stream-combiner ## pipeline (stream1,...,streamN) Turn a pipeline into a single stream. `pipeline` returns a stream that writes to the first stream and reads from the last stream. Listening for 'error' will recieve errors from all streams inside the pipe. > `connect` is an alias for `pipeline`. ``` js es.pipeline( //connect streams together with `pipe` process.openStdin(), //open stdin es.split(), //split stream to break on newlines es.map(function (data, callback) {//turn this async function into a stream callback(null , inspect(JSON.parse(data))) //render it nicely }), process.stdout // pipe it to stdout ! ) ``` ## License MIT
